intro: Catananche arenaria, commonly known as the sand catananche, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a member of the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in sandy or rocky soils and thrives in dry, coastal environments. Its yellow flowers bloom in the summer, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Catananche arenaria is often found in maritime climates and is adapted to withstand harsh, saline conditions.
